item.title: Leaked letter indicates Notting Hill Carnival requires urgent funding to continue.
item.description:

**Summary:** The chair of the Notting Hill Carnival, Ian Comfort, has reached out to the culture secretary, Lisa Nandy, to discuss the need for government funding to ensure the event's continuation. While the letter does not specify the amount required, it highlights the importance of financial support for sustaining the carnival.

item.title: Thomas Frank emphasizes the importance of taking risks to help Spurs become consistent winners.
item.description:
**Headline:** Thomas Frank Aims to Build on Tottenham's Success and Encourage Attacking Play
**Summary:** Thomas Frank, the new Tottenham manager, expressed admiration for his predecessor Ange Postecoglou, praising his achievement of winning the Europa League, which ended the club's 17-year trophy drought. Frank, who is joining from Brentford on a three-year contract, is focused on continuing the positive momentum and is committed to fostering an attacking style of play at the club. His goal is to build on recent successes and work towards securing more victories and memorable achievements for Tottenham.

item.title: Federal Reserve maintains current interest rates despite Trump's request for a reduction.
item.description:
**Headline:** Federal Reserve Maintains Interest Rates, Signals Possible Future Adjustments
**Summary:** The U.S. Federal Reserve has decided to keep interest rates unchanged for the time being. It has indicated the possibility of two rate reductions later in the year. This decision is part of the Fed's ongoing assessment of economic conditions, including inflation and growth projections. President Donald Trump has expressed his preference for lower rates, but the Fed remains focused on its independent economic measures.

item.title: Temperatures Expected to Reach 37°C in Paris and Bordeaux, 36°C in Lyon, as Heat Wave Peaks in France on Saturday

Summary: This weekend, many parts of France will experience a heatwave, with temperatures reaching 37°C in Paris and Bordeaux, and 36°C in Lyon. Cooler temperatures are expected as thunderstorms arrive on Monday.

item.title: Marcus Smith to play full-back as Lions prepare for tour against Argentina.
item.description:
Headline: Marcus Smith to Play Full-Back as Lions Prepare for Match Against Argentina
Summary: The British & Irish Lions have named their squad for the upcoming game against Argentina in Dublin. Maro Itoje will lead the team as captain for the first time, supported by eight other players from the English contingent. Notable inclusions in the starting lineup are Marcus Smith at full-back, with Alex Mitchell and Fin Smith in the half-back positions. Ireland's Tadhg Furlong, who recently recovered from a calf injury, will be part of the bench alongside Ronan Kelleher, providing an opportunity to prove their fitness. The team aims to set a positive tone for their forthcoming tour of Australia.

item.title: Phil Foden leads Manchester City to victory over Wydad AC, while Rico Lewis receives a red card.
item.description:
**Headline:** Phil Foden Shines in Manchester City's Victory Against Wydad AC, Despite Rico Lewis’ Red Card
**Summary:** In a midday match held in Philadelphia, Manchester City emerged victorious with a 2-0 win over Wydad AC, thanks to goals from Phil Foden and Jérémy Doku. After a review, Rico Lewis received a red card late in the game. This performance provided an early look at Manchester City's strategies for the 2025-26 season as they began their Club World Cup campaign. Tijjani Reijnders demonstrated versatility by effectively playing in midfield roles, while defensive adjustments could be seen due to the absence of Rúben Dias and John Stones from the starting lineup.
